website_summaries.verdict: This well-crafted American-made blade built for chop saws lets you resharpen teeth as needed for longer life.
pros: This heavy gauge blade features titanium carbide and a triple-chip grind to ensure clean, burr-free cuts
Features expansion slows that dissipate heat
Good for a wide range of metal projects

customer_reviews.title: EXPENSIVE AND MADE IN CHINA!
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this blade because it the cost is almost twice what the Evolution equivalent is. I dont expect anything that is made in China to be worth more than something that is made in Japan or the USA. Another reviewer stated that Dewalt had stopped making these in the USA or change supplier and they did not last as long as the ones made in the USA. I have ordered the Evolution Power Tools equivalent. I just had the hope that Dewalt had a trial run and came back to the USA blades. LET US NOT PAY THESE BIG NAMES, BIG MONEY FOR PRODUCTS THEY MAKE CHEAPLY IN CHINA WITH QUESTIONABLE QUALITY!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar B.

customer_reviews.title: Beware now made in CHINA!
customer_reviews.text: After many years of using the USA made blade which outlasted any other blade we had tried, the sell outs at DeWalt have now off shored the complete construction of the DWA7747 blade. Unfortunately, after using Chinese made blades before finding the US made DWA7747 , I'm expecting this Chinese blade to now produce the same sub par life and low quality cuts as all other Chinese blades produced. Nice job DeWalt on showing your true colors, not Black and Yellow but Red and Yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Keven Ballew

customer_reviews.title: 100 cuts = $1/cut!
customer_reviews.text: Only got maybe 100 cuts before it jammed up and bent on my dry cut saw, took it SLOW and used wax on most cuts too. Mostly worth it anyway because I had some small I-beams (W6x12), a dozen 2x4x1/4", and some 1" flat bar that needed cut and it would have been hard to do it any other way.... Amazing while it lasted, now I'm going to try the MK Morse one which is made in the USA like this DeWalt blade used to be and hopefully that can last me through the rest of my shipping container house project!
customer_reviews.author: Jill K.

customer_reviews.title: Tooth fell off almost immediately! With mild steel!
customer_reviews.text: A tooth fell almost immediately! Was cutting mild steel, only 1/8” with hardly ANY pressure at all! I am hoping this is an isolated even and it was just this particular saw that came deffective. I have other brands that have lasted quite a bit of constant use before getting them sharpened!
customer_reviews.author: pablo m.

customer_reviews.title: this blade did not last..
customer_reviews.text: I built a hitch basket out of .090 1 inch square tubing and the blade was dull by the end of the project. roughly 30 cuts in all. I used light pressure for the cutting process, basically just the weight of the cutting head and it was on a evolution saw. The factory evolution blade lasted much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Pay for quality
customer_reviews.text: I cut between . 095 material up to 1" cold rolled on a Evolution saw. I've only used two other brand names in the Phoenix area (that's all there is) and with two teeth missing on my DeWalt blade, it out performs the others especially on flat cuts. I'll never try anything else, one learned an expensive lesson. There are cheaper blades out there, you will regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: piston

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty blade, long lasting, great cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I probably made 500+ cuts with this blade in 1/4" steel angle, and square tubing before it finally started getting dull. I even cut quite a bit of heavy aluminum stock also with really good results. I was so happy with the performance I bought another identical blade and sent the old one to be sharpened. If you don't bear down and let the blade do the work you will get lots and lots of clean straight cuts.
customer_reviews.author: neil bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade!
customer_reviews.text: This blade is perfect for my steel cutting cut-off saw. I have made hundreds of cuts and the last nearly the equal of the first.
customer_reviews.author: Cubednewt02

customer_reviews.title: not as good of a cut as the Morse Metal Devil blade
customer_reviews.text: Does okay, not as good of a cut as the Morse Metal Devil blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Packaging from amazon was a little odd, but I would buy this again or recommend it to anybody. This is the 2nd blade I have used and so far it seems to be much better than my original SteelMax Blade. I would not throw out a new blade specifically to upgrade to this one.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We use this in a police evidence room to cut up guns the court orders destroyed. The women make it look easy.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: fair blade
customer_reviews.text: the blade cuts well , but its not really that much better than the lower priced Oshlun. Personally I wont spend over $100 for this blade when the Oslun is $71.00 and i get as many cuts. theres not a sharpener in my area, so i dont know the price of resharpening these blades.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife thru butter
customer_reviews.text: This thing will cut 3/8 steel plate so fast you will think you are cutting plywood... very impressed
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Good blade
customer_reviews.text: Cut 57+ pieces of 1/4" x 1-1/2 angle iron w/o problems. Perfect fit on my DeWalt dry cut saw. Arrived ahead of last delivery date.
customer_reviews.author: Beefydad

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good cuts
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this blade for a couple of work days, but can verify that it cuts well. It cuts quickly and cleanly. We're very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy a 3rd
customer_reviews.text: The first one lasted for 3 years of moderate use, estimated 1000-3000 cuts (no idea). I bought a cheaper one to replace the 1st and it only lasted 1 year. Ended up buying another Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Well, I don't know what I could say about a Dewalt product. But the pricing is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: amazing how much steel can be cut with one blade
customer_reviews.text: These blades last and last, amazing how much steel can be cut with one blade. Leaves nice clean edge that is warm at most to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RPM reqirements
customer_reviews.text: love it but had to buy a new saw with lower RPM to use it safely per instructions on packaging. Our Dewalt was too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Righteous.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know that these saws existed. I love it. I cut one inch hot rolled mild steel bar with it. It lasts longer than I expected(three months and counting)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Maxson

customer_reviews.title: This blade is AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a band saw in our home fab shop for 35 years. I just bought an Dewalt chop saw and this blade. I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THE BANDSAW. This blade is AWESOME!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: it provides excellent quality, great performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: This the only saw blade that I use ,it provides excellent quality, great performance and durability .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I've never used a saw that cut aluminum like it was wood
customer_reviews.text: Granted this is part of a new chop-saw, but I've never used a saw that cut aluminum like it was wood. What was a 15min cut with a recip-saw became a 20sec one with this bugger
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: There is no substitute
customer_reviews.text: I've tried cheaper blades...Don't bother. this blade lasts ten times longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Lone Star Welding and Fabrication
customer_reviews.text: Great cold saw blade for metal . Highly recommend it .. I have ordered and used many. Best blade and best prices I have found. Outlasts other brands by far.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Schuessler

customer_reviews.title: Good blade!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an overall good blade. We chop some steel and a lot of aluminum. This is the same blade that came on the saw. Since we chop a lot of aluminum we purchased aluminum specific blades. This blade is much better on aluminum than those were. Their shipping was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Fred S.

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I don't like is that I put up with the blade that ...
customer_reviews.text: This blade cuts perfectly! Only thing I don't like is that I put up with the blade that came on my Norther Tools saw for a year. My advice- throw away the cheap blade and buy this DeWalt, best investment a metal worker can make!!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: A quality DeWalt product
customer_reviews.text: I find this blade to out-cut the carbide tipped porter-cable blade. It’s been in service for the past five months and still cuts like the first day
customer_reviews.author: Remy M

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cutting our threaded rods in our Assembly operation
customer_reviews.text: Works great for cutting our threaded rods in our Assembly operation. As long as you don't force it through the metal. it should last for many cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Doug23

customer_reviews.title: Best aluminum cutting blade on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best aluminum cutting blade on the market. works great for steel as well, but we cut alum 95% of the time
customer_reviews.author: Matt Loganbill

customer_reviews.title: good quality blade
customer_reviews.text: excellent blade, goes through 1/4 inch steel like butter. ive owned 3 so far. every day use in welding shop. they last me about 8 months. and im not easy on them
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ely

customer_reviews.title: Longest lasting blade I've used so far. I've tried ...
customer_reviews.text: Longest lasting blade I've used so far. I've tried the evolution and metal devil blades but they don't last no where near as long as dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Fred K Fenske

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: do not attempt to cut bed rails with this they are tempered beyound belief
customer_reviews.author: tom teslovich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my dewalt is fast for this blade is the best cut cool yea!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: joe schall

customer_reviews.title: Will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: It did cut good for about 15 cuts then the teeth started breaking off.
customer_reviews.author: abel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY DO THE JOB I BUY OTHER BRAND AND ...
customer_reviews.text: GREAT QUALITY DO THE JOB I BUY OTHER BRAND AND WELL I DONT KNOW IF THIS ONE IS DISING FOR MY MACHINE BUT THIS ONE WORK GREAT
customer_reviews.author: mario vargas

customer_reviews.title: The Dewalt Blades Last
customer_reviews.text: I've purchase cheaper blades than these, for a savings of 20-30 dollars. The cheaper blades last a fraction of the time that the Dewalt blades do.
customer_reviews.author: C. Toombs

customer_reviews.title: Just did not last
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 3-4 weeks. Then it went really bad.
customer_reviews.author: intermarksteel

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Used properly
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used properly, it will last for quite some time. Very satisfied. I use it in a mairenance repair shop for a construction company. Use it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blade
customer_reviews.text: Worked awesome until an accident knocked the teeth off. Got it resharpened and a few carbide points replaced and it's back to great ($20) - so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great blade!  Got it right away!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Cuts beautifully! Got it right away! I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip D. DiDonato

customer_reviews.title: Soo much better than an abrasive blade
customer_reviews.text: Cuts cleanly and precisely. No flex or wavering. Just cut slowly and let the blade do the work. No more grinding after the cut.
customer_reviews.author: mach1

customer_reviews.title: Good for a few cuts but the tips break off very easily
customer_reviews.text: Tips break off after just an hour or so of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Sarault

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement blade for the Evolution saw
customer_reviews.text: Works great in a Rage2 dry cut saw, but wanders a bit even at very slow feeds with 3/16" angle.
customer_reviews.author: zeromaster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Use this in a shop with ~45-50 engineering students. They abuse it and it keeps going. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade
customer_reviews.text: Gets about 750-900 cuts. I just took one to see if it can be resharpened. Last much better than other blades I've used..
customer_reviews.author: Cstubb

customer_reviews.title: Metal cutting saw blade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the one that I bent. A piece of angle iron got jammed. This one works as well as the Milwaukee blade that came with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I made 6 cuts in 2" angle iron, 1/8" thick. I was very patient, cut very slow, used an oil based cutting lubricant, and my brand new blade barely made it through the last cut. This is the first Dewalt product I have EVER had a problem with. I followed the included directions exactly and I have just wasted my money. Did I mention I was dissapointed?
customer_reviews.author: Steven E Parker

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product for the money, I've been cutting structural steel with the same blade for over a year. I always mist the blade with water when I'm cutting, seems to help keep the blade cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Conlin

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this blade I've only used abraxive wheels in my Porter Cable chop saw. So far I am very pleased with how well this blade cuts through metal. My grinding after every cut has been "cut" down to almost none which saves me all kinds of time. I've only had this blade for a week but I would recommend this purchase to anyone using abrasive wheels. I'm amazed and unless this blade fails right away I won't be going back to abrasive wheels any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: best metal cutting system ever
customer_reviews.text: These cutting blades are fantastic. We have be using these for more than ten years and a blade will make hundreds of perfect cuts through the equivalent of 3/8 x 3 x 3 angle iron providing you are sure to properly clamp the stock.
customer_reviews.author: cornguy

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT DW7747 14-Inch 70 Tooth Heavy Gauge Ferrous Metal Cutting Saw...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blade to cut metal studs. Started out super but after 100 studs or so getting dull and leaving ragged edges.
customer_reviews.author: Garnett169

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: teeth started chipping right away now its useless after just a couple weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Paradis

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: If you have been using abrasive wheels in your chop saw you are missing out.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Gilland

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade
customer_reviews.text: well if you have a saw like this then you already know how awesome it is.. as long as your work piece is clamped down securely, the blade cuts awesome!!! I totally recomend this blade and the saw it came with!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It cuts fast and in the long run, it ...
customer_reviews.text: It cuts fast and in the long run, it cuts more steel than the cheap blades for the same money.
customer_reviews.author: Max Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price for a great blade.
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using been using these blades in my chop saw for years. Great value For the Dollars. Quick shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: eric d hall

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Metal Cutting Blade
customer_reviews.text: Theses blades are incredible and when used properly work as good as any fine wood chop or miter saw. No one get's to use it that is not trained on how to. Cost is not prohibitive to the untrained. Still going strong after several jobs.
customer_reviews.author: DNA Dave

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!!!
customer_reviews.text: When we first looked at how aggressive the teeth are on this blade it was a little intimidating. This saw and blade cut like no other. Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: LaDane Smith

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt Metal Cutting Blades
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how we got along before these blades and slow speed cut saws were invented, but if you're still using abrasive blades, you don't know what you're missing!
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Barmettler

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Terrible lifespan. Tried the blade twice averaging about a month per blade. Bought the porter cable riptide, let's hope it's better
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping for better
customer_reviews.text: The blade seemed to cut alright, didn't last very long, wasn't a real clean/smooth cut and it was super loud to use, I will probably run other blades before I buy another on of these
customer_reviews.author: Skliker

customer_reviews.title: great for cutting up old pallets too
customer_reviews.text: it has 66 sharp teeth and garanteed to throw hot chips so watch out, and be careful not to use too much downward force. great for cutting up old pallets too
customer_reviews.author: scott silva

customer_reviews.title: new broom
customer_reviews.text: The new DeWalt blade is like a new broom, it will gives you a clean sweep !!
customer_reviews.author: Sure

customer_reviews.title: When new it cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: Works great but doesn't last as much as the older version 72 vs. 66 teeth
customer_reviews.author: Alex C. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Dry cut blade
customer_reviews.text: I don't personally use this blade. I resell it. Most people who use this blade, give it a good rating and they seem to think it is well priced. I have bought these for some time and will continue to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: ejl1959phxaz

customer_reviews.title: The blade Dulls quickly
customer_reviews.text: This blade does not last much longer than an abrasive blade. Based on the cost of this blade, abrasive blades are less expensive to operate.
customer_reviews.author: roger baker

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt chopsaw the best blade I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This dewalt chop saw blade is the best blade I have ever used. When using this blade do not force the blade when cutting if done you could put to much pressure on it and brake one of the carbon tip. It would be a very expensive experience. I have purchased several of the blades for my 2 chop saws. I would purchase another one again.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blade for cutting heavier guage mild steel. Runs smooth and can be resharpened several times to extend the life of the blade. Works well on my milwaukee saw.
customer_reviews.author: canoer79

product_meta.title: DEWALT 14-Inch Metal Cutting Blade, Ferrous Metal Cutting, 66-Tooth (DWA7747)
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
Outfit your DW872 Multi-Cutter Saw for tough metal work applications with this heavy-gauge DeWalt DW7747 14-Inch Ferrous Saw Blade featuring a 1-inch arbor.This 70-tooth blade is capable of making an average of 1,200 cuts in most materials rotating at 1800 rpm, and it is designed to let you resharpen the teeth for improved cutting and a longer life. It is crafted with 12-percent titanium carbide and features expansion slots that dissipate heat. Plus it offers a tri-foil braze that increases the strength of each tooth's tip for exceptional durability, while a modified triple chip tooth grind helps ensure clean, burr-free cuts for beautiful finished projects.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
DeWalt DW7747 14-Inch 70 Tooth Heavy Gauge Ferrous Metal Cutting Saw Blade with 1-Inch Arbor.Manufacturer location:USA.
feature_bullets: 12% titanium carbide provides long life in metal cutting
Modified ATB tooth geometry provides clean, burr-free cuts
Tri-foil braze absorbs stress, making the tip stronger
Expansion slots dissipate heat which extends blade life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars161 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
